events.name: Tufts Hackathon 2013 - Presented By Evernote
events.about:
For full schedule & Event details - Check out tuftshackathon.com


About the Tufts Hackathon 2013

We are hosting Tufts second Hackathon, an all-night coding/designing extravaganza. Make your idea something tangible with a team of your friends in 24 hours. Plenty of free food, caffeine, and swag.

The Hackathon will start off with a few short, informal pitches from our awesome Sponsors. After that you can either hack away or go to their workshops and learn how to utilize their APIs and products. And at the end of the event, there will be prizes donated by our sponsors!

Come alone, or with team. YOU DONT NEED AN IDEA TO COME. Well help you find people to work with and ideas to work on.

12:45 pm Arrive, Check-in
1:15 pm Introductions
1:30 pm Find teams / Get Situated

2:00 pm Workshops (Optional) and Begin Hacking

  • 2:00 pm Echonest / SendGrid
  • 3:00 pm Twilio / Microsoft
  • 4:00 pm Evernote / Crashlytics


5:30 pm Dinner!
6:00 pm HackHackHackHack
12:00 am Midnight Ice Cream - Thanks GitHub!
11:30 am Move to Sophia Gordon for pitches
12:00 pm Lunch Provided

12:15 pm Pitches begin in Sophia Gordon! (Tickets available to view the pitches!)

How to Sign Up
Help us get the right mix of participants by picking the right ticket: if you can code, pick the developer/engineer ticket, 60 available. Can you do HTML or visual design but not code? Pick the designer/UX ticket, 40 available. Content developer, marketer or startup enthusiast? Pick Ideas / Other, 10 available. There is no charge to attend but we can only fit a limited number of people so sign up early.

Plenty of food and refreshments will be provided on Saturday and Sunday, just bring your own computer.
